intro: Podalyria monosperma, commonly known as the single-seeded podalyria, is a flowering plant belonging to the legume family, Fabaceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, where it grows in rocky and sandy soils. The plant produces small, pea-like flowers that range in color from white to pale purple. Its seed pods are elongated and contain a single, large, kidney-shaped seed. Podalyria monosperma is often found in open vegetation and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments.
